Container.Name: Vikunja
Container.Overview: The open-source, self-hostable to-do app - organize everything, on all platforms. For advanced configuration, see all supported configuration options: (https://vikunja.io/docs/config-options/)

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: The port to serve the frontend WebUI.

Config.Name: Application Data Directory
Config.Description: The directory application data is saved.

Config.Name: Configuration Directory
Config.Description: The directory where your config.yml is located.

Config.Name: Enable Registration
Config.Description: Whether to let new users registering themselves or not.

Config.Name: Database Type
Config.Description: Database type to use, possible values are 'sqlite', 'mysql', or 'postgres'.

Config.Name: (SQLite) SQLite Database Path
Config.Description: (SQLite) When using SQLite for database storage, this is the path to your database file.

Config.Name: (MySQL/Postgres) Database Host
Config.Description: (MySQL/Postgres) The host to use for your database.

Config.Name: (MySQL/Postgres) Database Username
Config.Description: (MySQL/Postgres) The database username to use.

Config.Name: (MySQL/Postgres) Database Password
Config.Description: (MySQL/Postgres) The database account password.

Config.Name: (MySQL/Postgres) Database Name
Config.Description: (MySQL/Postgres) The name of the database to use.

Config.Name: Mailer Enabled
Config.Description: Whether to enable the mailer or not. If it is disabled, all users are enabled right away and password reset is not possible.

Config.Name: Mailer Host
Config.Description: The SMTP host name to use if the mailer is enabled.

Config.Name: Mailer Port
Config.Description: The SMTP port value to use if the mailer is enabled.

Config.Name: Mailer Auth Type
Config.Description: SMTP Auth Type. Can be either 'plain', 'login' or 'cram-md5'.

Config.Name: Mailer Username
Config.Description: The SMTP username to use.

Config.Name: Mailer Password
Config.Description: The SMTP password to use.

Config.Name: Mailer Skip TLS
Config.Description: Wether to skip verification of the TLS certificate on the server.

Config.Name: Mailer Skip TLS
Config.Description: The default from address when sending emails.

Config.Name: Mailer Force SSL
Config.Description: By default, vikunja will try to connect with starttls, use this option to force it to use SSL.

Config.Name: Public URL
Config.Description: The public facing URL where your users can reach Vikunja, used in emails and for the communication between API and frontend.

Config.Name: Enable Email Reminders
Config.Description: If enabled, Vikunja will send an email to everyone who is either assigned to a task or created it when a task reminder is due.

Config.Name: Enable User Deletion
Config.Description: If true, will allow users to request the complete deletion of their account. When using external authentication methods it may be required to coordinate with them in order to delete the account.

Config.Name: Custom Logo URL
Config.Description: Allow using a custom logo via external URL.

Config.Name: CORS Enabled
Config.Description: Whether to enable or disable CORS headers. Note: If you want to put the frontend and the API on separate domains or ports, you will need to enable this otherwise the frontend won't be able to make requests to the API through the browser.

Config.Name: CORS Allowed Origins
Config.Description: A list of origins which may access the API, these need to include the protocol (http:// or https://) and port, if any.

Config.Name: CORS Max Age
Config.Description: How long (in seconds) the results of a preflight request can be cached.
